page.title: 18Religion
page.content: Owing to a large influx of Irish immigrants to help man the furnaces at the then newly founded Iron Company, Consett has a thriving{Roman Catholic community. A high percentage of these people attend church on Sundays and special days during the year. So although Catholics form a minority of the total population in the area they are certainly the largest practising religious group.{St.Patricks church has two priests and laymen who carry out duties such as visiting sick people. The rest of the population have in the main been baptised in the local church of England or one of the several Methodist chapels. The {Salvation Army}has a base in Consett and has the distinction of having formed the first{Salvation Army Band Most people do not attend church.
